intro: Amitostigma papilionaceum, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is native to the western United States. This perennial herb is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that resemble small lanterns, typically blooming in late spring. It grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers with prominent white stamens. It is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions to thrive.
